author: @4ian
description:
Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.

Firing bullets:
- Cooldown: Time between shots (seconds)
- Bullet Quantity: Number of bullets created each time Fire Bullet action is used. 
- Angle Variance: Each bullet trajectory will be adjusted by a random value within this range (degrees)
- Firing Arc: Range of angles (in degrees) that bullets will shoot. Bullets are evenly spread within this range.
- Rotate bullet: Change the angle of each bullet to match the direction it is travelling (enabled by default)

 Ammo:
- Starting ammo
- Max ammo
- Shots per reload. Use 0 to disable reloading
- Reload duration
- Automatic reloading is enabled by default, but it can also be done manually.

Overheat:
- Heat increase per shot. Object is Overheated when Heat reaches  1.
- Cooling rate per second
- When overheated, the object cannot fire any bullets

Statistics:
- Total bullets created
- Total shots taken
- Total reloads completed

Bullets:
- Each bullet is assigned several variables that can be used for advanced object picking
- __FireBullet.BulletID = Unique number for every bullet created
- __FireBullet.BatchID = Unique number for all bullets created in the same frame
- __FireBullet.BatchOrderID = Unique number for each bullet in the same batch. Can be used to identify the position in the firing arc.
name: FireBullet
shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing cooldown (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while firing cooldown is active
propertyDescriptors.name: FireCooldown

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing arc (degrees)
propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the Firing Arc
propertyDescriptors.name: FiringArc

propertyDescriptors.label: Number of bullets created at once (Multi-Fire)
propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the Firing Arc
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletQuantity

propertyDescriptors.label: Angle variance (degrees)
propertyDescriptors.description: Used to simulate imperfect aim (Range: 0 to 180 degrees)
propertyDescriptors.name: AngleVariance

propertyDescriptors.label: Reloading duration (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while reloading is in progress
propertyDescriptors.name: ReloadDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Max ammo
propertyDescriptors.description: Use "0" to disable restrictions on ammo capacity
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxAmmo

propertyDescriptors.label: Total shots fired
propertyDescriptors.description: Regardless of how many bullets are created, only 1 shot will be counted per frame
propertyDescriptors.name: TotalShotsFired

propertyDescriptors.label: Heat increase per shot (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object is overheated when Heat reaches 1
propertyDescriptors.name: HeatIncreasePerShot

propertyDescriptors.label: Overheat duration (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while overheat duration is active
propertyDescriptors.name: OverheatDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Exponential cooling rate (per second)
propertyDescriptors.description: Exponential cooling happens faster when heat is high and slower when heat is low
propertyDescriptors.name: ExponentialCoolingRate
